title: add support for pikpak

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that!
You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Probably the latest beta (or stable) release has your feature, so try to update your rclone.
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If it still isn't there, here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Search the old issues for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org/t/request-for-yet-another-cloud-support/31315`



#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?
rclone v1.59.1
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 21H1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.19043.1889 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.18.5
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount

I also use the Linux version: 
rclone v1.59.1
- os/version: ubuntu 20.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.4.0-84-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.18.5
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
requesting for a new Storage support called pikpak. The post on forum wasn't from me, but I also want to suggest it.
Their website is: https://mypikpak.com/

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?
Add a new storage support. They seems like have no api for it yet, but [the project mentioned on the forum](https://github.com/alist-org/alist) might be help. It said they [support pikpak](https://alist.nn.ci/guide/) file listing.
The pikpak website is: https://mypikpak.com/


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your feature request. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
